content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Enjoyable clash! Thought first I could do it in one line. Here is my python solution:

total = int(input())
width = int(input())
center = int(input())

lower = center-width//2-1
upper = center+width//2

if center - width // 2 <= 0:
    lower = 0
    upper = width

if center + width // 2 > total:
    lower = -width
    upper = total

    
print(*range(1,total+1)[lower:upper])

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: unique and fun

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great clash! I really liked it, very different from the others.

Not very hard, but looks fun : it has to be the algorithm used by forum makers so that you can click on page (let's say) 5 when you're on page 1 (do you see what I mean or am I not clear enough?)
For the statement, instead of "the page you should try to put in the center of the pagination", write: "the number of the page" : initially, I thought you would have to manipulate strings or pages or whatever.
